item.title: Considerations on error handling
item.description: The impact The first language I used to build something more than just school exercises was VisualBasic.Net. There are some good things and bad things in it, but I don’t want to discuss that today. I switched to C# after that and Java and Python after it. This is to say that basically up until three years ago I knew one and only one way to handle errors which is expressed in the following pseudocode:
